title: STARSHIP_SHELL should be pwsh when running under PowerShell Core
body:
#### Current Behavior
Starship on PowerShell Core sets `STARSHIP_SHELL` to "powershell" while it should be "pwsh" (This is also what is causing the `bug-report` command to fail to detect the shell version, I had to fill it manually. It also fails to detect Windows Terminal which I also filled manually)

#### Expected Behavior
`STARSHIP_SHELL` should be `pwsh` when running under PowerShell Core and `powershell` when running under ye olde Windows PowerShell.

#### Additional context/Screenshots
<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. If applicable, add screenshots to help explain. -->
I'm not sure what is the right way to set this, one nasty way is:
```powershell
(Get-Process -Id $PID).ProcessName
```
But I'm not sure if there is any simple variable in PowerShell with this information.

#### Possible Solution
<!--- Only if you have suggestions on a fix for the bug -->
